chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Karive-Ya Flowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work or school or combination of both.

No contact with M.G.W.
No contact with Kwik Trip at 109223 West Lapham Street in West Allis, WI.
Complete a 2 page essay regarding future goals and how a felony conviction would impact you.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court sets restitution at $191.00 payable to Kwik Trip.  Joint and several with codefendant Cameron Flowers 22CF1671.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karive-Ya Flowers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Karive-Ya Flowers.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 of the AMENDED INFORMATION.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- NO CONTACT with M.G.W.
- NO CONTACT with Kwik Trip at 10923 West Lapham Street in West Allis, WI.
- Complete 24 hours of community service. 
- Complete a 2 page essay regarding future goals and how a felony conviction would impact you.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court sets restitution at $191.00, payable to Kwik Trip, Joint and several with co-defendant Cameron Flowers 22CF1671.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Karive-Ya Flowers.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pretrial. Defense is requesting a plea hearing date. Court vacates trial dates. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers not in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Karive-Ya Flowers.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Parties inform the court of ongoing negotiations and possible resolution.  Defendant does not appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court scheduled an adjourned final pre-trial/projected guilty plea.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed: State's Witness List
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed: Defense's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Case called with co-defendant C. FLOWERS 22CF1671. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Case set for final pretrial and Jury Trial.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Case called with co-defendant FLOWERS 22CF1671. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz; both appear by video.  William Berens appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective L. Binter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no contact with Kwik Trip -West Allis, Michael w.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Karive-Ya Flowers in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
